Label: p-S724-ERN1
Comment: IRE1 is trans-autophosphorylated after dissociation from BiP and autodimerization. By homology with the yeast IRE1, human IRE1 is believed to be phosphorylated at Ser724 (Ser841 of Saccharomyces cerevisiae)

Label: genes
Comment: The N-terminal fragment of ATF6-alpha contains a bZIP domain and binds the sequence CCACG in ER Stress Response Elements (ERSEs). ATF6-alpha binds ERSEs together with the heterotrimeric transcription factor NF-Y, which binds the sequence CCAAT in the ERSEs, and together the two factors activate transcription of ER stress-responsive genes. Evidence from overexpression and knockdowns indicates that ATF6-alpha is a potent activator but its homolog ATF6-beta is not and ATF6-beta may actually reduce expression of ER stress proteins.

Label: chaperone genes
Comment: Xbp-1 (S) binds the sequence CCACG in ER Stress Responsive Elements (ERSE, consensus sequence CCAAT (N)9 CCACG) located upstream from many genes. The ubiquitous transcription factor NF-Y, a heterotrimer, binds the CCAAT portion of the ERSE and together the IRE1-alpha: NF-Y complex activates transcription of a set of chaperone genes including DNAJB9, EDEM, RAMP4, p58IPK, and others. This results in an increase in protein folding activity in the ER.

Label: p-S724-ERN1
Comment: IRE1 is trans-autophosphorylated after dissociation from BiP and autodimerization. By homology with the yeast IRE1, human IRE1 is believed to be phosphorylated at Ser724 (Ser841 of Saccharomyces cerevisiae)

Label: p-S724-IRE1 dimer
Comment: After juxtaposition of the luminal N-termini of IRE1 to form the IRE1 homodimer, the cytoplasmic C-terminal kinase domains of the IRE1 molecules associate and transphosphorylate each other's A-loop domains. This causes a change in conformation that allows binding of ADP.

Label: PERK:BiP
Comment: The N-terminal luminal domain of PERK (EIF2AK3) binds BiP, rendering PERK inactive.

Label: reticulum  stress
Comment: ATF4 is a transcription factor and activates expression of IL-8, MCP1, IGFBP-1, CHOP, HERP1 and ATF3.

Label: IRE1 dimer
Comment: Crystallographic evidence indicates that the IRE1 homodimer forms by an initial interaction between the luminal N-terminal domains of IRE1 monomers.

Label: dimer:ADP
Comment: Phosphorylated IRE1 homodimers preferentially bind ADP (as opposed to ATP) and this binding promotes association of the cytoplasmic C-termini. Crystallographic evidence indicates that unphosphorylated A-loops of IRE1 interfere with nucleotide binding thus trans-autophosphorylation is a prerequisite to nucleotide binding.

Label: ATF6:BiP
Comment: The luminal C-terminus of ATF6-alpha binds BiP, occluding  two Golgi Localization Sequences and causing ATF6-alpha to be retained in the endoplasmic reticulum.

Label: BiP:Unfolded Protein
Comment: BiP is a chaperone which binds unfolded proteins as well as the luminal domains of UPR signal transducers ATF6, IRE1, and PERK (EIF2AK3).

Label: IRE1:BiP
Comment: The luminal N-teminal domain of IRE1 binds the ATPase domain of BiP, rendering IRE1 inactive.

Label: ATF6(1-380)
Comment: ATF6-alpha is cleaved by S1P after amino acid 419 (RHLL). It is also cleaved by S2P at an unknown site. The product of cleavage is about 50 kd.

Label: PERK dimer
Comment: PERK (EIF2AK3) monomers form dimers, resulting in activation of the kinase activity of the cytosolic C-terminal region.
